definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]

sentences.english: With dizziness insomnia, five frustrating heat, night sweat, apical dishes, pulse counting.
sentences.chinese: 伴頭暈失眠，五心煩熱，盜汗，舌尖暗紅。

sentences.english: Q. How can you distinguish between night sweats that indicate a serious medical condition and those that don't?
sentences.chinese: 你如何區分提示嚴重疾病狀態的夜間盜汗與普通出汗？

sentences.english: A new medication, with perspiration as a side effect, is the culprit.
sentences.chinese: 有出汗副作用的新藥常常是盜汗的魁首。

sentences.english: Night sweats can be a symptom of some cancers, for example lymphomas .
sentences.chinese: 盜汗可以成爲某些癌症的症狀，例如淋巴瘤。

sentences.english: I lost weight and had night sweats.
sentences.chinese: 我的體重一直在降，夜裏常常盜汗。

sentences.english: There are two kinds of hidrosis syndrome in Chinese medicine, spontaneous perspiration and night sweat.
sentences.chinese: 中醫的汗證主要包括自汗和盜汗兩種。

sentences.english: I really don't feel a bit sick , no night sweats, no fevers.
sentences.chinese: 我真的感覺一點毛病也沒有，沒盜汗也不發熱。

definition: disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
injury such as contusion, sprain or fracture from falling, blow etc
